description: This function draws a visual representation of fractional multiplication, using shaded and unshaded rectangles to depict the fractions being multiplied. It is designed to aid in the understanding of fractional multiplication by providing a visual, tangible representation of the concept.

educational_standards.display_name: Multiplying a Mixed Number by a Whole Number
educational_standards.description: Multiply mixed numbers by whole numbers.
Calculate the area of rectangles with fractional sides.

educational_standards.display_name: Multiplying with Mixed Numbers: Word Problems
educational_standards.description: Solve real world problems involving multiplication of a fraction and a mixed number, or two mixed numbers.
Solve real world problems involving multiplication of two fractions.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Fractional Multiplication Models
stimulus_type_specification.description: This function can draw visualizations of fractional multiplication. It accepts two fractions as input, represented as strings in the format 'numerator/denominator'. The function then draws a rectangle divided into a grid, with the number of cells in the grid corresponding to the denominators of the fractions. A portion of the grid is shaded, representing the product of the two fractions. This visualization can be used in educational settings to help students understand the concept of fractional multiplication.

details: model_data: A FractionSet object containing two fractions represented as strings in the format 'numerator/denominator'.
The first fraction determines the length and shaded length of the rectangle, while the second fraction determines the width and shaded width.
The fractions must be valid, i.e., the numerator must be less than or equal to the denominator, and the denominator must not be zero.
The fractions are split into numerator and denominator using the '/' character, so this character must be present in the input strings.
The function draws a rectangle divided into a grid, with the number of cells in the grid corresponding to the denominators of the fractions.
A portion of the grid is shaded, representing the product of the two fractions.
The size and position of the shaded area change based on the input fractions.
